<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 483, 181, 502]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 483, 920, 515]]<|/det|> Describe **one** precaution that you would take to ensure that the temperature readings in the experiment are as accurate as possible. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 559, 920, 578]]<|/det|> [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 72, 180, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Calculate the average cooling rate \(x_{1}\) during the first 90 s of the experiment. Use the readings from Table 2.1 and the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 109, 554, 139]]<|/det|>
\[x_{1} = \frac{\theta_{0} - \theta_{90}}{T}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 147, 787, 167]]<|/det|>
where \(T = 90 \text{s}\) and \(\theta_0\) and \(\theta_{90}\) are the temperatures at \(t = 0\) and \(t = 90 \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 164, 490, 183]]<|/det|>
Include the unit for the cooling rate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 225, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<form>\[x_{1} = ............................................................\] [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 256, 181, 275]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 255, 920, 291]]<|/det|>
Calculate the average cooling rate \(x_{2}\) during the middle 90 s of the experiment. Use the readings from Table 2.1 and the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 293, 561, 325]]<|/det|>
\[x_{2} = \frac{\theta_{90} - \theta_{180}}{T}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 333, 834, 354]]<|/det|>
where \(T = 90 \text{s}\) and \(\theta_{90}\) and \(\theta_{180}\) are the temperatures at \(t = 90 \text{s}\) and \(t = 180 \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 395, 920, 415]]<|/det|>
<form>\[x_{2} = ............................................................\] [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 427, 180, 445]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 427, 920, 462]]<|/det|>
Calculate the average cooling rate \(x_{3}\) during the last 90 s of the experiment. Use the readings from Table 2.1 and the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 465, 566, 496]]<|/det|>
\[x_{3} = \frac{\theta_{180} - \theta_{270}}{T}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 504, 853, 524]]<|/det|>
where \(T = 90 \text{s}\) and \(\theta_{180}\) and \(\theta_{270}\) are the temperatures at \(t = 180 \text{s}\) and \(t = 270 \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 566, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
<form>\[x_{3} = ............................................................\] [1]
